name: Introduction to Biology
description: An introductory course covering the basics of cellular structure, genetics, evolution, and ecosystems.

name: Organic Chemistry II
description: A continuation of Organic Chemistry I, focusing on reaction mechanisms, synthesis, and spectroscopy.

name: General Physics I
description: Covers classical mechanics, including motion, forces, energy, and momentum, with laboratory experiments.

name: Linear Algebra
description: Introduces matrix theory, vector spaces, determinants, eigenvalues, and eigenvectors.

name: Introduction to Computer Science
description: A beginner-level course covering basic programming concepts, data structures, and algorithms.

name: World Literature
description: Explores classic and contemporary literary works from around the world, with an emphasis on cultural context.

name: Modern World History
description: Examines major global events and trends from the 19th century to the present.

name: Cognitive Psychology
description: Focuses on mental processes including perception, memory, reasoning, and problem-solving.

name: Advanced Microeconomics
description: Analyzes market structures, consumer behavior, and game theory in microeconomic contexts.

name: Art History: Renaissance to Modern
description: Covers major artistic movements from the Renaissance period to the modern era, focusing on key works and artists.
